body.p: Enclosed I send you a petition asking the remission of a fine against J. G. Everett -- I had expected to present it in person but find that I will not be able to come to Frankfort until about the 20th of the month -- The replevin bond is about due and it is of great importance to Everett to keep any execution from issuing against him at this time --

If you can do so, it would be a great relief to him to respite it until Jan. 1st 1862; and when I come up I will state his case fully -- As all executions are stayed until March next, I hope that you will be able to prevent any from issuing against him until the time named, and thus save cost &c --
Please have the respite, if one is granted, sent to me immediately --
Your message has been quite favorably received here by all classes so far as my observation extends --

Hon B. Magoffin
Gov of Ky, Frankfort
